We are set out to build the world’s best way to shop and our successful consumer products are enabled by numerous world-class platforms that provide capabilities to Klarna’s product teams and/or external partners. We are building solutions within a wide range of problem spaces - stretching from payment network integrations, ads serving, ledger capabilities, to modern order management APIs and best in class business portals.We are looking for technical Product Managers who strive to build world-class, business-critical platform products to support massive growth across many geographies and verticals. You’ll have experience building highly scalable, available, and robust services in close collaboration with your customers. You’ll know how to get things done and are comfortable taking big decisions with the extensive accountability you have. You are comfortable to speak in swimlanes, service to service architecture, APIs, ML models and data structures - and understand how these topics directly impact our customers’ lives.What You'll Be Doing... Building and owning a business-critical product with a potential reach of 200+ Klarna product teams and/or 200K+ external partners Setting an inspiring vision, strategy and metrics for your product Being ultimately responsible for making that product valuable and viable Creating alignment on your vision, roadmap, and KPI’s within your team and throughout the organisation Being the expert in knowing who your customer is and what problems you are solving for, always taking decisions in favour of the customer, even when it’s hard or uncomfortable Understanding the markets and competitors landscape in which your product operates Using qualitative and quantitative insights and validating hypotheses with users Leading a cross-functional product team, building and owning a product with a real impact on millions of consumersWe believe in diverse perspectives and highly value people who are curious about consumer products and the future of shopping and banking; as well as new technologies and payments (acquiring, issuing, lending, subscriptions, cards etc.). We look for leaders who can both dive deep into details and set overarching strategies, who want a rewarding career with a steep learning curve.We’d Love To Meet Someone With Software Product Management experience leading a cross functional team Experience in taking a product from concept to launch, creating product roadmaps, driving UX decisions, and steering technical implementation discussionsPreferably You Also Have Experience of building highly scalable platform products Experience at a high growth company Experience coaching/managing junior Product Managers Experience building global products or driving localization of products We also love Product Managers that can design or code but it’s not a must have!Product at KlarnaJoining us means joining a diverse group of problem-solvers spread across Klarna’s development hubs in Stockholm, Berlin, Giessen, Milan, Madrid, Gothenburg, Lisbon and Toronto. In addition, we can offer an attractive relocation package. We build products in cross-functional teams and empower them to solve hard problems - customer problems and business problems - in ways that our customers love, yet work for our business. Our teams have end-to-end ownership of their problem space, are aligned on long term vision rather than projects, and are measured on outcome rather than output.Product Managers at Klarna lead their teams to solve challenging problems in a fast paced environment, and we look for people who don't shy away from a challenge. Joining Klarna means being part of a global team that creates the world's smoothest shopping & banking experience, serving over 100 million consumers worldwide.Our ways of working are designed to make sure we foster team collaboration, whilst also ensuring a productive and hybrid work environment. We offer full work flexibility for you to choose if you want to work from home, office or other locations within your country of employment. Visa mer Visa mindre

The power of Risk Analytics is the possibility to deep-dive into different subjects related to credit risk that are not necessarily included within the problem space of individual operational teams. The scope is further set to bring together all products and countries into a portfolio perspective.Day To Day Will See YouIt´s crucial to work closely with the global credit risk group, the risk management team, and the domains support team by taking clear ownership over tasks and being able to deliver ad hoc tactical/strategic data-based analysis:Support the head of credit running monthly consumer credit commiteé and own the weekly credit monitoring and monthly credit risk insights reportingCollaborate with the underwriting teams to produce deep dives or analyses of specific issues and present them to stakeholders in different forums (Monthly credit committee, for example). Set up credit portfolio monitoring to ensure the entire credit process works properly and measure the performance of the global credit portfolio. Use those insights to push for better risk management.Broad policy questions regarding the consumer loan market, the pink standards website, and the SFSA:s consumer loan report.Drive data/definition alignment toward the one source of truth approach for data within the Payment Method domain. Capable of driving CXO forums and asking the right questionsCapable of driving process improvement workstreams end-to-end.General regulatory and accounting knowledge when it comes to credit risk accounting (e.g: IFRS 9, capital requirements, etc) Set the standards for continuous improvementAn understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation, as well as programming languages, is a plus (SQL, R, Python, MatLab, Java, C#, etc.).Significant drive and ambition.Experience in using structured approaches to problem-solving.Fantastic stakeholder management skills.A curious mindset - you’ll be someone who loves to question the why! We are set out to build the world’s best way to shop and our successful consumer products are enabled by numerous world-class platforms that provide capabilities to Klarna’s product teams and/or external partners. We are building solutions within a wide range of problem spaces - stretching from payment network integrations, ads serving, ledger capabilities, to modern order management APIs and best in class business portals.We are looking for technical Product Managers who strive to build world-class, business-critical platform products to support massive growth across many geographies and verticals. You’ll have experience building highly scalable, available, and robust services in close collaboration with your customers. You’ll know how to get things done and are comfortable taking big decisions with the extensive accountability you have. You are comfortable to speak in swimlanes, service to service architecture, APIs, ML models and data structures - and understand how these topics directly impact our customers’ lives.What You'll Be Doing... Building and owning a business-critical product with a potential reach of 200+ Klarna product teams and/or 200K+ external partners Setting an inspiring vision, strategy and metrics for your product Being ultimately responsible for making that product valuable and viable Creating alignment on your vision, roadmap, and KPI’s within your team and throughout the organisation Being the expert in knowing who your customer is and what problems you are solving for, always taking decisions in favour of the customer, even when it’s hard or uncomfortable Understanding the markets and competitors landscape in which your product operates Using qualitative and quantitative insights and validating hypotheses with users Leading a cross-functional product team, building and owning a product with a real impact on millions of consumersWe believe in diverse perspectives and highly value people who are curious about consumer products and the future of shopping and banking; as well as new technologies and payments (acquiring, issuing, lending, subscriptions, cards etc.). We look for leaders who can both dive deep into details and set overarching strategies, who want a rewarding career with a steep learning curve.We’d Love To Meet Someone With Software Product Management experience leading a cross functional team Experience in taking a product from concept to launch, creating product roadmaps, driving UX decisions, and steering technical implementation discussionsPreferably You Also Have Experience of building highly scalable platform products Experience at a high growth company Experience coaching/managing junior Product Managers Experience building global products or driving localization of products We also love Product Managers that can design or code but it’s not a must have!Product at KlarnaJoining us means joining a diverse group of problem-solvers spread across Klarna’s development hubs in Stockholm, Berlin, Giessen, Milan, Madrid, Gothenburg, Lisbon and Toronto. In addition, we can offer an attractive relocation package. We build products in cross-functional teams and empower them to solve hard problems - customer problems and business problems - in ways that our customers love, yet work for our business. Our teams have end-to-end ownership of their problem space, are aligned on long term vision rather than projects, and are measured on outcome rather than output.Product Managers at Klarna lead their teams to solve challenging problems in a fast paced environment, and we look for people who don't shy away from a challenge. Joining Klarna means being part of a global team that creates the world's smoothest shopping & banking experience, serving over 100 million consumers worldwide.Our ways of working are designed to make sure we foster team collaboration, whilst also ensuring a productive and hybrid work environment. We offer full work flexibility for you to choose if you want to work from home, office or other locations within your country of employment. Visa mer Visa mindre

We are set out to build the world’s best way to shop and our successful consumer products are enabled by numerous world-class platforms that provide capabilities to Klarna’s product teams and/or external partners. We are building solutions within a wide range of problem spaces - stretching from payment network integrations, ads serving, ledger capabilities, to modern order management APIs and best in class business portals.We are looking for technical Product Managers who strive to build world-class, business-critical platform products to support massive growth across many geographies and verticals. You’ll have experience building highly scalable, available, and robust services in close collaboration with your customers. You’ll know how to get things done and are comfortable taking big decisions with the extensive accountability you have. You are comfortable to speak in swimlanes, service to service architecture, APIs, ML models and data structures - and understand how these topics directly impact our customers’ lives.What You'll Be Doing... Building and owning a business-critical product with a potential reach of 200+ Klarna product teams and/or 200K+ external partners Setting an inspiring vision, strategy and metrics for your product Being ultimately responsible for making that product valuable and viable Creating alignment on your vision, roadmap, and KPI’s within your team and throughout the organisation Being the expert in knowing who your customer is and what problems you are solving for, always taking decisions in favour of the customer, even when it’s hard or uncomfortable Understanding the markets and competitors landscape in which your product operates Using qualitative and quantitative insights and validating hypotheses with users Leading one or more cross-functional teams. building and owning a critical product or a group of products with a real impact on millions consumers Fostering a culture that utilises solid product practices to deliver at the right qualityWe believe in diverse perspectives and highly value people who are curious about consumer products and the future of shopping and banking; as well as new technologies and payments (acquiring, issuing, lending, subscriptions, cards etc.). We look for leaders who can both dive deep into details and set overarching strategies, who want a rewarding career with a steep learning curve.We’d Love To Meet Someone With Solid software Product Management experience leading a cross functional team Experience in taking a product from concept to launch, creating product roadmaps, driving UX decisions, and steering technical implementation discussionsPreferably You Also Have Experience in building banking or payments systems/platforms Experience at a high growth company Experience coaching/managing junior Product Managers Experience of building regulated products across many markets We also love Product Managers that can design or code but it’s not a must have!Senior Product Manager VS Product ManagerDuring The Interview Process We Will Evaluate Your Seniority Of Building Products In Comparison To Our Expectations, As a Reference We Believe a Senior Product Manager Is Someone Who HasAt Klarna, levels are not connected to a role, instead they are a sign of your level of experience and skills. Experience building high quality products in a fast paced environment Experience of multiple successful product deliveries Experience owning a portfolio or area of products Experience enabling the full potential in other Product Managers A deep expertise in at least one area Demonstrated ability to drive change across an organisationProduct at KlarnaJoining us means joining a diverse group of problem-solvers spread across Klarna’s development hubs in Stockholm, Berlin, Giessen, Milan, Madrid, Gothenburg, Lisbon and Toronto. In addition, we can offer an attractive relocation package. We build products in cross-functional teams and empower them to solve hard problems - customer problems and business problems - in ways that our customers love, yet work for our business. Our teams have end-to-end ownership of their problem space, are aligned on long term vision rather than projects, and are measured on outcome rather than output.Product Managers at Klarna lead their teams to solve challenging problems in a fast paced environment, and we look for people who don't shy away from a challenge. Joining Klarna means being part of a global team that creates the world's smoothest shopping & banking experience, serving over 100 million consumers worldwide.Our ways of working are designed to make sure we foster team collaboration, whilst also ensuring a productive and hybrid work environment. At Klarna we embrace change, you should dare to challenge the status quo and be persistent in doing so.What Will You DoRisk Analytics is a team that is meant to have a broad global knowledge of Klarna´s credit portfolio and all of the data and processes connected to credit risk. The power of Risk Analytics is the possibility to deep-dive into different subjects related to credit risk that are not necessarily included within the problem space of individual operational teams. The scope is further set to bring together all products and countries into a portfolio perspective.Day To Day Will See YouIt´s crucial to work closely with the global credit risk group, the risk management team, and the domains support team by taking clear ownership over tasks and being able to deliver ad hoc tactical/strategic data-based analysis:Support the head of credit running monthly consumer credit commiteé and own the weekly credit monitoring and monthly credit risk insights reportingCollaborate with the underwriting teams to produce deep dives or analyses of specific issues and present them to stakeholders in different forums (Monthly credit committee, for example). Set up credit portfolio monitoring to ensure the entire credit process works properly and measure the performance of the global credit portfolio. Use those insights to push for better risk management.Broad policy questions regarding the consumer loan market, the pink standards website, and the SFSA:s consumer loan report.Drive data/definition alignment toward the one source of truth approach for data within the Payment Method domain. Capable of driving CXO forums and asking the right questionsCapable of driving process improvement workstreams end-to-end.General regulatory and accounting knowledge when it comes to credit risk accounting (e.g: IFRS 9, capital requirements, etc) Set the standards for continuous improvementAn understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation, as well as programming languages, is a plus (SQL, R, Python, MatLab, Java, C#, etc.).Significant drive and ambition.Experience in using structured approaches to problem-solving.Fantastic stakeholder management skills.A curious mindset - you’ll be someone who loves to question the why! Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.Role is based in Central London (Holborn) however flexible working is supported and can be further discussed on application. We are set out to build the world’s best way to shop and our successful consumer products are enabled by numerous world-class platforms that provide capabilities to Klarna’s product teams and/or external partners. We are building solutions within a wide range of problem spaces - stretching from payment network integrations, ads serving, ledger capabilities, to modern order management APIs and best in class business portals.We are looking for technical Product Managers who strive to build world-class, business-critical platform products to support massive growth across many geographies and verticals. You’ll have experience building highly scalable, available, and robust services in close collaboration with your customers. You’ll know how to get things done and are comfortable taking big decisions with the extensive accountability you have. You are comfortable to speak in swimlanes, service to service architecture, APIs, ML models and data structures - and understand how these topics directly impact our customers’ lives.What You'll Be Doing... Building and owning a business-critical product with a potential reach of 200+ Klarna product teams and/or 200K+ external partners Setting an inspiring vision, strategy and metrics for your product Being ultimately responsible for making that product valuable and viable Creating alignment on your vision, roadmap, and KPI’s within your team and throughout the organisation Being the expert in knowing who your customer is and what problems you are solving for, always taking decisions in favour of the customer, even when it’s hard or uncomfortable Understanding the markets and competitors landscape in which your product operates Using qualitative and quantitative insights and validating hypotheses with users Leading a cross-functional product team, building and owning a product with a real impact on millions of consumersWe believe in diverse perspectives and highly value people who are curious about consumer products and the future of shopping and banking; as well as new technologies and payments (acquiring, issuing, lending, subscriptions, cards etc.). We look for leaders who can both dive deep into details and set overarching strategies, who want a rewarding career with a steep learning curve.We’d Love To Meet Someone With Software Product Management experience leading a cross functional team Experience in taking a product from concept to launch, creating product roadmaps, driving UX decisions, and steering technical implementation discussionsPreferably You Also Have Experience of building highly scalable platform products Experience at a high growth company Experience coaching/managing junior Product Managers Experience building global products or driving localization of products We also love Product Managers that can design or code but it’s not a must have!Product at KlarnaJoining us means joining a diverse group of problem-solvers spread across Klarna’s development hubs in Stockholm, Berlin, Giessen, Milan, Madrid, Gothenburg, Lisbon and Toronto. In addition, we can offer an attractive relocation package. We build products in cross-functional teams and empower them to solve hard problems - customer problems and business problems - in ways that our customers love, yet work for our business. Our teams have end-to-end ownership of their problem space, are aligned on long term vision rather than projects, and are measured on outcome rather than output.Product Managers at Klarna lead their teams to solve challenging problems in a fast paced environment, and we look for people who don't shy away from a challenge. Joining Klarna means being part of a global team that creates the world's smoothest shopping & banking experience, serving over 100 million consumers worldwide.Our ways of working are designed to make sure we foster team collaboration, whilst also ensuring a productive and hybrid work environment. We offer full work flexibility for you to choose if you want to work from home, office or other locations within your country of employment. Visa mer Visa mindre

The job is varied and ranges between the development of services that enable the teams across Klarna to focus on their core mission as well as automation and operations around some of Klarna's most critical infrastructure.Our approach to infrastructure is that everything needs to be automated and robustly deployed through pipelines with a high degree of confidence through tests and deployment patterns.The team is looking for an engineer with a passion for large-scale systems development, automation, and operations.Your ResponsibilitiesAs an engineer, you will work within a specific problem space critical to the whole organization where you will design, develop and deploy services with a focus on high availability, performance, and robustnessBe part of a team that takes full operational responsibility for the services that we own, and take part in an on-call rotationBuild solutions that enable other klarna teams to deliver value while helping the evolve our team's best practicesSupport Klarna Engineers and teams to solve and debug issues they experience with our products and take that chance to spot and propose opportunities that will help improve our servicesWhat Will Make You SuccessfulExperience with CI/CD - JenkinsSome amount of coding experienceInterest in infrastructure automationCritical thinking and analytical skillsCollaboration and coordination skills.A passion for test automation code.Your MindestCustomer Obsession: this is also our team's core value but we want to take that one step further and abstract it also to our internal Klarna customers. Your opinions and ideas on how we can enable other Klarna teams to bring value to our Klarna CustomersDelivery Quality Results: We are responsible for some of the most critical foundational services and infrastructure that a large part of Klarna's acquiring flows pass-throughLet the team shine: we value teamwork and collaboration within us and have the mindset where everybody's voice is heard and everybody contributes to every service that we ownChallenge the status quo: we expect you to challenge solutions if they don't provide an impact to Klarna customers.Nice To HaveLinuxBashPerformance & Robustness testingAWS (Cloudformation, EC2, ALB, S3, Lambda, Kinesis)DatadogJava / PythonWhat We OfferDiversity & CommunityWith our diversity of skills, perspectives and backgrounds, we can create, innovate, and disrupt like no other. We’re organized into hundreds of small teams, each run like a start-up, focused on their own problem-space.Trust & CollaborationSuccesses and failures are won together at Klarna in a melting pot of teams. Win, lose, and learn, we’re on this path together.If you love what you do, you should love where you do it. We appreciate that everyone’s different and has their own preferences of where and how to work. We genuinely believe in the power of regular face-to-face interactions in building close connections with our teams, but we also strongly believe people can work effectively remotely. This means that combining both is the key to success.At Klarna, You can choose between working from the office, remotely within your employment country, or even outside of it for up to 20 working days per year. Flex it up! ﻿Challenges & RewardsWe take a very Swedish approach to benefits. Support for parents, health and wellness perks—we’ve got you covered.About KlarnaSince 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. Over 450,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 6,000 employees and is active in 45 markets. Scania´s purpose is to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system, creating a world of mobility that is better for business, society, and the environment. To this end, our corporation is undergoing a radical transformation, from being a global traditional heavy vehicle manufacturer to becoming a leading provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. Communication and digital technologies are one key element, among several, for a successful realization of the ongoing transformation.Scania’s Communications Department operates globally with several key stakeholders. We are now recruiting for a temporary position, a talented and passionate colleague to our team of skilled content producers, who can contribute to enhancing and evolving our presence in our digital channels.The roleWith a focus on online editorial and marketing communication, we seek an Online Editor who will be a part of a team and, on a daily basis, prepare, produce, publish, and be close to content. The work is managed in a cross-functional team where we have core competencies needed to produce assets, from high-end production in different formats to short social media posts and everything in between.Core Responsibilities IncludeAdapt and develop content to keep up with an ever-changing digital world, which is needed to support Scania’s transformation journey.With your skills work to increase engagement and knowledge about Scania’s products, services, and strategies to support the transformation our corporation is undergoing.On a daily basis distribute and be close to published content; moderate, adapt, follow-up, and analyze the effect of communication, so that we continuously improve the content and the way we work, with content and in the channels.Compile content ie collect, write short copy, and distribute a monthly newsletter reaching a global audience.You are to be regarded as our trusted and experienced online editor with extensive knowledge in digital communication and editorial/marketing content, mainly social media but also other platforms for web, SEO, and analytics. Your experience in B2B and/or B2C digital communication has given you a broad knowledge of online audience behaviors that you will bring with you to evolve the creative content work.To that end, you are to form strong relationships and collaborate closely with the core team within the communications department as well as colleagues across the organisation.Success in this role requires a broad understanding of all aspects of digital communication, from algorithms to SoMe-follower behavior.Your profileYou Have Work Experience Frominterpreting communication assignments and how to convert them into online communication. For different stakeholders, in different channels how to drive growth and create value for online audiencesworking in tight teams with content production, with colleagues as well as external resourcesmanagement of multiple assignments that requires a “here and now” mindsetwork in international and inter-cultural contexts that require communication skills in spoken and written English / SwedishEducationYou have an academic degree or similar from a recognized institution, in Media or Journalistics.3+ years of experience working with digital channels for larger corporations, B2B or B2C, or in journalism.As a person we look forYou are a highly valued team player and an excellent communicator. You are structured, proactive, and have experience in project assignments. You are a self-motivated and creative person with problem-solving drive, interpersonal skills, and the ability to adapt quickly to shifting priorities.We offerYou will be part of a team that puts online communication first. We have been at the forefront of editorial business communication for more than a decade. This consistent, hard but fun work has rewarded us with an audience of several million followers, all over the world. We will continue this work, with high-quality content voicing the stories of our customers and products, on our path to becoming a leader in the transport business.In addition to personal and professional development opportunities, we offer onsite- and remote work and a dynamic and inclusive work culture. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express. Above all, we offer you a unique opportunity to contribute positively to Scania’s digital transformation and thereby to a more sustainable future!Further informationIf you have any questions or simply want to have a dialogue, don’t hesitate to contact Ann-Helen Tolleman (ann-helen.tolleman@scania.com).ApplicationPlease apply as soon as possible, no later than May 15, 2023. Your application shall include a personal letter and CV as well as copies of any relevant certificates.Selection and interviews will take place continuously.We look forward to your application!A background check might be conducted for this position. Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.Scania Purchasing is responsible for purchasing of products and services for all of Scania's units in the world, with the Head office located in Södertälje and an office in Sergel Stockholm City. Our Purchasing organisation is divided into four departments; two are responsible for purchasing direct materials for Scania's trucks, buses and Power solutions and two are responsible for purchasing spare parts, superstructures and indirect materials. Scania is currently in a shift from being a supplier of heavy vehicles to a supplier that offers complete and sustainable transport solutions. In parallel with this, Scania is leading the development of large common projects within TRATON, so this position at Purchasing will also give a chance for collaboration within the TRATON group.We are currently looking for a new curious and ambitious Business Controller who wants to join our diverse team and develop our business!In your Business Controller role, you will work closely and support a Purchasing department by being part of the departments management team, and at the same time be part of the Purchasing Controller team (SZB). You will report directly to the Group Manager Business Control and have a dotted line to the Purchasing Department Manager. You will also work in cross-functional processes and have a wide network with other finance departments at Scania. One of the biggest and most exciting challenges in finance at Scania right now is the transition to more automated working methods. It covers everything from processes to systems and will enable more time for business support and lead to us working more proactively.Today the Business controlling team consists of 7 people with a good spread both in terms of experience, age, gender and culture. The team works result-oriented and is constantly driven by achieving short- and long-term goals. This we do with strong team spirit and at the same time with a lot of fun.Your work assignmentsControl, guide, steer and support a Purchasing departmentFull member of the management teamCollaboration with our colleagues at TRATON/MAN/NavistarResponsible for budget, forecasts and follow-up of the resultLead various projectsDevelop the role of Business ControlSupport in Ad-Hoc tasksWe have a hybrid way of working and have the possibility to work remotely some daysYour profileYou have a Master of Business Administration or a Master of Science in Industrial Engineering (Industrial Finance). Requirement of at least 3 years experience in Controlling. We expect you to be a confident person who has good communication skills and likes to be a part of driving the business towards set targets. You should have the ability to take your own initiative and be comfortable working without clearly defined frameworks. As you will be sitting in a management team representing finance, you must be prepared to put on the “Sheriff’s badge” from time to time.You should have high social skills and have easy to create relationships as you will have a wide network with many contact points. It’s also essential that you have good analytical ability and see the details as well as the big picture, good data handling is key for the position. You should have the ability to work at a high pace in a structured way and always strive to deliver what you promise.Finally, the environment at Purchasing is international so you need to be fluent in spoken and written English.But enough about us - we would love to hear more about you! If you are ready for the next step in your career don’t hesitate to submit your application, the challenge is waiting around the corner!For Further Information ContactRecruiting manager: Alexandra Lindén, Group Manager Business Control, tel. 08-553 813 18Lucy Deniz, Head of Business Control & Analysis, tel. 08-553 804 52ApplicationApply via our website: www.scania.com/jobb no later than May 21st. Jobid 20232632The application must contain a personal letter, CV and grade copies. A background check might be conducted for the position. Interviews will be conducted a long this time period.Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com. Visa mer Visa mindre

We do have upcoming projects within the software and electronic systems. Our corporate culture is characterised by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. Our employees are our most important asset, so we will invest in you to help you grow with us. You have your team's well-being and performance in focus and work as a servant leader securing that the team fill the gaps needed for the Solution to deliver value. With your eminent communication skills, you can easily interact with different persons in various positions within the company. You will report to senior stakeholders regularly. You need to be comfortable with presenting and facilitating larger groups in English (written as well as oral).Scania offersAs a Scania employee, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. Job ID: 16996 We are searching for an experienced Head of Data. This is a unique opportunity for you to utilise your extensive data expertise to support the fight against financial crime together with us.At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.About This OpportunityYou will lead the Data unit in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA), you will be responsible for a team of data specialists located across the Nordics and Estonia. The role can be based in Helsinki, Stockholm, or Tallinn. You will join a committed and enthusiastic team passionate about creating data driven solutions.What you’ll be doing:Responsible for the data strategy in FCIIA, building solutions to support data intensive complex investigations and proactive intelligence activity along with advanced analytics to support next generation monitoring capabilities. Coordinate and lead a data program, building a financial crime data hub, transforming internal and external data into homogeneous datasets and building a risk tagging framework to support advanced analytics solutions. Recruit, manage and coach a team of data specialists, responsible for the data change program and the subsequent business run activities. Vi söker en erfaren Javautvecklare som vill vara med på en spännande förändringsresa och driva utvecklingen inom integrationslöning för Partsdata hos oss på Handelsbanken.Handelsbanken är en stabil arbetsgivare med generöst förmånspaket och det finns stora möjligheter att göra karriär inom organisationen. Tjänsten är placerad i centrala Stockholm, vi applicerar flexibelt arbetsliv vilket ger dig möjlighet att kombinera hemarbete med arbete på kontoret utifrån verksamhetens behov. Om tjänsten Du blir en del av ett av våra agila team med javautvecklare, Scrum Master, Agile Product Owner och Business Analyst. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe och förvaltar och utvecklar systemet som är en viktig del i vår integrationslösning avseende partsdata. Teamet är en central del av många spännande utvecklingsinitiativ i banken.I rollen som javautvecklare tillhör du området som driver utvecklingen av masterdata framåt i banken. Vi ansvarar för att underhålla och vidareutveckla det centrala kundregistret, den centrala avtalskomponenten, bankens produktregister samt ett flertal andra mindre system som stöttar de s.k. kärnkomponenterna.Vi har en komplex miljö och vår teknikstack består av bl.a.:JavaEEREST och SOAPGIT, Teamcity, Sonarcube, XrayTeamet arbetar med en blandning av förvaltning och nyutveckling, där nyutvecklingen står för en större del av arbetet. Vi jobbar med ett utforskande arbetssätt där teamet tillsammans är de som tar fram lösningen för det som efterfrågas. Vi provar regelbundet nya tekniker, och utvecklare uppmuntras att titta på lösningar och teknik som kan göra arbetet lättare. I teamet tillämpar vi par- och mobprogrammering, såväl som utveckling individuellt. Dina kompetenser och personliga egenskaper Du har flera års erfarenhet av utveckling i Java EE. Vi ser att du har teknisk-utbildning eller motsvarande kunskaper som du fått genom tidigare arbete. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.Som person har du ett stort eget driv och tar egna initiativ. Du drivs av att jobba i ett team med hög lagkänsla och som delar med sig och ställer upp för varandra. Du är ansvarstagande och lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra för att hitta lösningar.För att lyckas i rollen ser vi även att det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:GITMavenREST och SOAPTeamcityArtifactorySonarcubeXrayJUnit eller MockitoPKI Vi erbjuder Trygg arbetsgivareSpännande och utmanande arbetsuppgifterWork-life balanceUtvecklingsmöjligheterHybridarbeteSunda värderingar kring samhällsansvar och hållbarhetHälsa och friskvårdTjänstepension och försäkringPersonal-, lunch- och föräldraförmåner samt rådgivningSjälvklart vet vi att du är unik med dina erfarenheter samt dina personliga egenskaper och vi ser fram emot att höra vad du kan bidra med i denna roll! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum. Välkommen med din ansökan. Om oss Med över 2000 medarbetare är vi en av Sveriges största tech-organisationer. Vi tror på framtiden, lika mycket som vi är stolt över vår historia. Därför är vi ständigt på jakt efter nya förmågor som ser utmaningar och möjligheter i vårt digitaliseringsarbete. Det gäller allt från drift, underhåll och systemförvaltning till utveckling, innovation och design. Vi är en decentraliserad organisation där du som medarbetare får ett stort eget ansvar. Långsiktiga affärsrelationer, lågt risktagande och kostnadsmedvetenhet är hörnstenar i Handelsbankens företagskultur och lägger grunden för att vår verksamhet bedrivs på ett ansvarsfullt, hållbart och framgångsrikt sätt. När vi rekryterar nya medarbetare söker vi efter personer som delar bankens grundläggande värderingar. Målet är att våra medarbetare ska spegla den marknad som vi verkar i – med olika bakgrund, kompetens och arbetslivserfarenhet samt olika sätt att tänka och lösa problem. Visa mer Visa mindre

Are you passionate about advanced analytics, AI and data engineering? Do you want to lead our engineering team in providing state-of-the-art data solutions that enable us to deliver insights and models that drive Handelsbanken forward in a data-driven way? Then you should apply for the position as Engineering Team Lead and help us in our mission - to be a leader in using data, advanced analytics and AI to deliver superior products, service, and experience to our customers! Our Team As a key part of delivering on our mission we have set out to build brand new analytics platforms both on prem and in the Microsoft Azure cloud suite. Our engineering team works closely with other teams throughout the bank in an environment characterized by initiative, collaboration, and innovation to tackle business challenges by predicting outcomes, understanding complex data relationships and constructing models that contribute to a better experience for our customers. Together we are the tech savvy engineers who enable a customer-centric way of designing and building our analytics and data platforms. Your Role You will work in a cross-functional engineering team together with data scientists and business analysts to implement use cases identified for and by the business. You will also coach a team of various engineering roles in ML, data, DevOps and SW through leading by example. Coordinating the engineering team’s efforts in delivering superior stable data pipelines and model serving capabilities is at the core of your everyday work. This role is an excellent opportunity to develop both your technical and leadership abilities.Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Understand priorities, set requirements, and define a roadmap for our platform capabilities in collaboration with the Head of Data & ML Engineering and the Tech Lead,Plan and follow up on the day-to-day work, make sure that the team is focusing on the right tasks.Coordinate with stakeholders and relevant teams in other parts of the bank.Support the team’s well-being.Contribute with hands-on engineering work ranging from DevOps to Data & ML.Together with the Tech Lead, make sure that we are constantly improving on our ML & Data pipelines to deliver maximum business value. About You You have a master’s degree or equivalent in a technical field with above average academic results.You have excellent problem-solving skills and enjoy solving problems with code.Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Data/ML-oriented engineering role.Formal or informal experience of leading a team.Experience in Linux with a deep understanding of system design.You are willing to learn, or already know, basic Swedish.You constantly want to learn new skills and are proactive with your own development.Experience working with data and building data pipelines with respect to data modeling, orchestration and validation.Well versed in Python and SQL.It is meriting if you have experience of:Working with containerized development in a Linux environment.Working with test-driven development.Dbt, Prefect and Spark.Being in a scrum master role.We are looking for a person who fits the positive, friendly, and supportive culture of Handelsbanken. The ideal candidate is curious, inventive, strives for improvement every single day and shares our aim to be smart, humble and, above all, collaborative. We Offer The chance to develop fast, make a big impact and cut out new paths in an expanding team at the core of Handelsbanken’s ambitious focus on digitalization.An abundance of interesting opportunities and a focus on building new capabilities, not just maintaining what others have already created.A friendly and collaborative work environment where colleagues learn and achieve together.Competitive compensation and pension plan.Extensive benefit package (subsidized banking services, health care, lunch and more) .Flexibility to work from home part of the time.Office at prime location in central Stockholm. Your Application We look forward to receiving your CV. Furthermore, we are particularly interested in previous team work experience, what motivates you and achievements that you are proud of.The promotion of gender equality, diversity and an inclusive corporate culture is a fundamental part of our values. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to submit their applications. About us With over 2,000 employees, we are one of Sweden’s largest tech organisations. Our focus on the future is matched by our pride in our history. Therefore we’re constantly on the lookout for people with new skills who can see the challenges and opportunities in our digitalisation work. This applies to everything from operations, maintenance and system management to development, innovation and design. We have a decentralised organisational structure, in which you the employee are trusted to take a high degree of responsibility. Long-term business relations, low risk-taking and cost-awareness are cornerstones of Handelsbanken’s corporate culture. They form the basis of our banking operations being run in a responsible, sustainable and successful manner.When we recruit, we seek people who share the Bank’s fundamental values. The goal is for employees to reflect the markets in which we operate – with different backgrounds, skills, and work experience, as well as different ways of thinking and solving problems. Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens system för att förhindra finansiell kriminalitet? Tillsammans gör vi skillnad för Handelsbanken och för hela samhället.Handelsbanken är en stabil arbetsgivare med generöst förmånspaket. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm, och området applicerar flexibelt arbetsliv vilket ger dig möjlighet att kombinera hemarbete med arbete på kontoret utifrån verksamhetens behov. Din roll I din roll som SAS-utvecklare kommer du att vara med i arbetet att bygga upp och införa en ny systemlösning från SAS Institute. Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö där arbetet med att identifiera och motverka finansiell brottslighet är i fokus. Du kommer att arbeta med både utveckling och förvaltning av Handelsbankens system för bland annat transaktionsmonitorering och kundscreening.Du kommer aktivt delta i ett högt prioriterat fortsatt förändringsarbete som berör hela koncernen och bidrar till att säkra leveranserna inom vårt område globalt. Vi jobbar i ett SAFe-tåg med cirka 60 medarbetare fördelade över 6 team, vilket innebär att du kommer få möjlighet att utveckla din kompetens inom det agila arbetssättet.Vi strävar efter tvärfunktionella team med kapacitet att arbeta med allt från dataförsörjning, datamodellering och ETL-arbete till implementation av transaktionsscenarier och screeningalgoritmer samt test och design av gränssnitt för utredning av larm. Hur din roll utformas beror mycket på din erfarenhet, dina kompetenser och dina egna intressen och drivkrafter. Dina kompetenser och personliga egenskaper Du har erfarenhet av SAS-utveckling på Windows/Linux. Du behöver ha god förståelse för både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift då vi jobbar med hela koncernen. Vi ser också att du har erfarenhet av ett agilt arbetssätt.Du är en person som drivs av utveckling i högt tempo och vill vara med på den förändringsresa som pågår inom vårt område. Som SAS-utvecklare kommer du över tid att jobba i olika team och med varierande arbetsuppgifter då vi ständigt utvecklar och förbättrar våra processer, vår organisation och hur vi arbetar. Därför söker vi en person som är strukturerad, nyfiken och har ett engagemang till att ständigt ta sig an nya utmaningar. Vi ser även att du är lösningsorienterad, noggrann samt flexibel.Det är meriterade om du har erfarenhet av:SQLverktyg för hantering av dataflöden (t.ex. SAS EG, LSF m.fl.)SAS Visual Investigator och SAS Visual Analyticsarbete inom området anti-penningtvätt och sanktionsscreening. Vi erbjuder Trygg arbetsgivareMöjligheter att utvecklas, både som individ och tillsammans med ditt team.Utmanande och utvecklande arbetsuppgifter.Work-life balanceSunda värderingar kring samhällsansvar och hållbarhetHälsa och friskvårdTjänstepension och försäkringPersonal-, lunch- och föräldraförmåner samt rådgivning Om oss Handelsbanken är en långsiktig och engagerad arbetsgivare. Vårt sätt att bedriva bank bygger framförallt på att vi har stor tilltro och respekt för den enskilde individen – både för våra kunder och våra medarbetare. Vi är en decentraliserad organisation där du som medarbetare får ett stort eget ansvar och stora befogenheter att ta egna beslut. Detta arbetssätt skapar delaktighet och ger varje medarbetare möjlighet att påverka bankens verksamhet. Långsiktiga affärsrelationer, lågt risktagande och kostnadsmedvetenhet är hörnstenar i Handelsbankens företagskultur och lägger grunden för att vår verksamhet bedrivs på ett ansvarsfullt, hållbart och framgångsrikt sätt över lång tid. För två år sedan firade vi 150 år som bank, kom och var med oss på nästa 150 år! Med över 2000 medarbetare är vi en av Sveriges största Tech-organisationer.Citat från Jonas, en av cheferna inom området: ”Att få arbeta inom området Financial Crime Prevention känns verkligen meningsfullt för mig på ett personligt plan, något jag inte upplevt i samma utsträckning i tidigare roller jag arbetat. Att identifiera och motverka finansiell kriminalitet är viktigt både för Handelsbanken och hela samhället i stort. Penningtvätt är ett gigantiskt globalt problem med stora konsekvenser för både individer och samhället och tillsammans inom området kan vi faktiskt göra skillnad! Det gillar jag.” Visa mer Visa mindre

Om oss Med över 2000 medarbetare är vi en av Sveriges största tech-organisationer. Vi tror på framtiden, lika mycket som vi är stolt över vår historia. Därför är vi ständigt på jakt efter nya förmågor som ser utmaningar och möjligheter i vårt digitaliseringsarbete. Det gäller allt från drift, underhåll och systemförvaltning till utveckling, innovation och design. Vi är en decentraliserad organisation där du som medarbetare får ett stort eget ansvar. När vi rekryterar nya medarbetare söker vi efter personer som delar bankens grundläggande värderingar. Målet är att våra medarbetare ska spegla den marknad som vi verkar i – med olika bakgrund, kompetens och arbetslivserfarenhet samt olika sätt att tänka och lösa problem. Visa mer Visa mindre

Arbeta med tjänsteorienterad arkitektur och framtidens betallösningar som IT-arkitekt hos Handelsbanken. Are you passionate about advanced analytics, AI and data engineering? Do you want to lead our engineering team in providing state-of-the-art data solutions that enable us to deliver insights and models that drive Handelsbanken forward in a data-driven way? Then you should apply for the position as Engineering Team Lead and help us in our mission - to be a leader in using data, advanced analytics and AI to deliver superior products, service, and experience to our customers! Our Team As a key part of delivering on our mission we have set out to build brand new analytics platforms both on prem and in the Microsoft Azure cloud suite. Our engineering team works closely with other teams throughout the bank in an environment characterized by initiative, collaboration, and innovation to tackle business challenges by predicting outcomes, understanding complex data relationships and constructing models that contribute to a better experience for our customers. Together we are the tech savvy engineers who enable a customer-centric way of designing and building our analytics and data platforms. Your Role You will work in a cross-functional engineering team together with data scientists and business analysts to implement use cases identified for and by the business. You will also coach a team of various engineering roles in ML, data, DevOps and SW through leading by example. Coordinating the engineering team’s efforts in delivering superior stable data pipelines and model serving capabilities is at the core of your everyday work. This role is an excellent opportunity to develop both your technical and leadership abilities.Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Understand priorities, set requirements, and define a roadmap for our platform capabilities in collaboration with the Head of Data & ML Engineering and the Tech Lead,Plan and follow up on the day-to-day work, make sure that the team is focusing on the right tasks.Coordinate with stakeholders and relevant teams in other parts of the bank.Support the team’s well-being.Contribute with hands-on engineering work ranging from DevOps to Data & ML.Together with the Tech Lead, make sure that we are constantly improving on our ML & Data pipelines to deliver maximum business value. About You You have a master’s degree or equivalent in a technical field with above average academic results.You have excellent problem-solving skills and enjoy solving problems with code.Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Data/ML-oriented engineering role.Formal or informal experience of leading a team.Experience in Linux with a deep understanding of system design.You are willing to learn, or already know, basic Swedish.You constantly want to learn new skills and are proactive with your own development.Experience working with data and building data pipelines with respect to data modeling, orchestration and validation.Well versed in Python and SQL.It is meriting if you have experience of:Working with containerized development in a Linux environment.Working with test-driven development.Dbt, Prefect and Spark.Being in a scrum master role.We are looking for a person who fits the positive, friendly, and supportive culture of Handelsbanken. The ideal candidate is curious, inventive, strives for improvement every single day and shares our aim to be smart, humble and, above all, collaborative. We Offer The chance to develop fast, make a big impact and cut out new paths in an expanding team at the core of Handelsbanken’s ambitious focus on digitalization.An abundance of interesting opportunities and a focus on building new capabilities, not just maintaining what others have already created.A friendly and collaborative work environment where colleagues learn and achieve together.Competitive compensation and pension plan.Extensive benefit package (subsidized banking services, health care, lunch and more) .Flexibility to work from home part of the time.Office at prime location in central Stockholm. Your Application We look forward to receiving your CV. Furthermore, we are particularly interested in previous team work experience, what motivates you and achievements that you are proud of.The promotion of gender equality, diversity and an inclusive corporate culture is a fundamental part of our values. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to submit their applications. About us With over 2,000 employees, we are one of Sweden’s largest tech organisations. Our focus on the future is matched by our pride in our history. Therefore we’re constantly on the lookout for people with new skills who can see the challenges and opportunities in our digitalisation work. This applies to everything from operations, maintenance and system management to development, innovation and design. We have a decentralised organisational structure, in which you the employee are trusted to take a high degree of responsibility. Long-term business relations, low risk-taking and cost-awareness are cornerstones of Handelsbanken’s corporate culture. They form the basis of our banking operations being run in a responsible, sustainable and successful manner.When we recruit, we seek people who share the Bank’s fundamental values. The goal is for employees to reflect the markets in which we operate – with different backgrounds, skills, and work experience, as well as different ways of thinking and solving problems. Are you passionate about advanced analytics, AI and data engineering? Do you want to be part of delivering outstanding data & ML applications? We are offering a role that allows you to learn and grow your knowledge within Data Science and Machine Learning, while being a key player in delivering on our mission - to be a leader in using data, advanced analytics and AI to deliver superior products, service, and experience to our customers! Our Team As a key part of delivering on our mission we have set out to build brand new analytics platforms both on prem and in the Microsoft Azure cloud suite. Our engineering team works closely with other teams throughout the bank in an environment characterized by initiative, collaboration, and innovation to tackle business challenges by predicting outcomes, understanding complex data relationships and constructing models that contribute to a better experience for our customers. Together we are the tech savvy engineers who enable a customer-centric way of designing and building our analytics and data platforms. Your Role You will work in a cross-functional engineering team together with data scientists and business analysts to implement use cases identified for and by the business. You will also be part of a team of various engineering roles in ML, data, DevOps and SW in which you create value from data by optimizing data and model flows. Delivering superior stable data pipelines and model serving capabilities is at the core of your everyday work. This role is an excellent opportunity for you to broaden your technical knowledge as well as receiving firsthand experience working in a large customer-centric organization.Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Develop and improve on our data & ML pipelines.Continuously evaluate and improve on our ML models and data solutions to better serve the business.Together with the engineering team be responsible for the integrity of our pipelines.Make sure that the team follows MLOps best practices. About You You have a master’s degree or equivalent in a technical field with above average academic results.You have excellent problem-solving skills and enjoy solving problems with code.Minimum 4 years’ experience as a Data/ML Engineer.Extensive experience in software development with a deep understanding of system design.Experience working with data and building data pipelines with respect to data modeling, orchestration and validation.Well versed in Python and SQL.You are willing to learn, or already know, basic SwedishYou constantly want to learn new skills and are proactive with your own developmentIt is meriting if you have experience of:Working with containerized development in a Linux environment.Experience working with test-driven development.Dbt, Prefect and Spark.We are looking for a person who fits the positive, friendly and supportive culture of Handelsbanken. The ideal candidate is curious, inventive, strives for improvement every single day and shares our aim to be smart, humble and, above all, collaborative. We Offer The chance to develop fast, make a big impact and cut out new paths in an expanding team at the core of Handelsbanken’s ambitious focus on digitalization.An abundance of interesting opportunities and a focus on building new capabilities, not just maintaining what others have already created.A friendly and collaborative work environment where colleagues learn and achieve together.Competitive compensation and pension plan.Extensive benefit package (subsidized banking services, health care, lunch and more) .Flexibility to work from home part of the time.Office at prime location in central Stockholm. Your Application We look forward to receiving your CV. Furthermore, we are particularly interested in previous team work experience, what motivates you and achievements that you are proud of.The promotion of gender equality, diversity and an inclusive corporate culture is a fundamental part of our values. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to submit their applications. About us With over 2,000 employees, we are one of Sweden’s largest tech organisations. Our focus on the future is matched by our pride in our history. Therefore we’re constantly on the lookout for people with new skills who can see the challenges and opportunities in our digitalisation work. This applies to everything from operations, maintenance and system management to development, innovation and design.We have a decentralised organisational structure, in which you the employee are trusted to take a high degree of responsibility. Long-term business relations, low risk-taking and cost-awareness are cornerstones of Handelsbanken’s corporate culture. They form the basis of our banking operations being run in a responsible, sustainable and successful manner. When we recruit, we seek people who share the Bank’s fundamental values. The goal is for employees to reflect the markets in which we operate – with different backgrounds, skills, and work experience, as well as different ways of thinking and solving problems. Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens system för att förhindra finansiell kriminalitet? Tillsammans gör vi skillnad för Handelsbanken och för hela samhället.Handelsbanken är en stabil arbetsgivare med generöst förmånspaket. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm, och området applicerar flexibelt arbetsliv vilket ger dig möjlighet att kombinera hemarbete med arbete på kontoret utifrån verksamhetens behov. Din roll I din roll som SAS-utvecklare kommer du att vara med i arbetet att bygga upp och införa en ny systemlösning från SAS Institute. Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö där arbetet med att identifiera och motverka finansiell brottslighet är i fokus. Du kommer att arbeta med både utveckling och förvaltning av Handelsbankens system för bland annat transaktionsmonitorering och kundscreening.Du kommer aktivt delta i ett högt prioriterat fortsatt förändringsarbete som berör hela koncernen och bidrar till att säkra leveranserna inom vårt område globalt. Vi jobbar i ett SAFe-tåg med cirka 60 medarbetare fördelade över 6 team, vilket innebär att du kommer få möjlighet att utveckla din kompetens inom det agila arbetssättet.Vi strävar efter tvärfunktionella team med kapacitet att arbeta med allt från dataförsörjning, datamodellering och ETL-arbete till implementation av transaktionsscenarier och screeningalgoritmer samt test och design av gränssnitt för utredning av larm. Hur din roll utformas beror mycket på din erfarenhet, dina kompetenser och dina egna intressen och drivkrafter. Dina kompetenser och personliga egenskaper Du har erfarenhet av SAS-utveckling på Windows/Linux. Du behöver ha god förståelse för både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift då vi jobbar med hela koncernen. Vi ser också att du har erfarenhet av ett agilt arbetssätt.Du är en person som drivs av utveckling i högt tempo och vill vara med på den förändringsresa som pågår inom vårt område. Som SAS-utvecklare kommer du över tid att jobba i olika team och med varierande arbetsuppgifter då vi ständigt utvecklar och förbättrar våra processer, vår organisation och hur vi arbetar. Därför söker vi en person som är strukturerad, nyfiken och har ett engagemang till att ständigt ta sig an nya utmaningar. Vi ser även att du är lösningsorienterad, noggrann samt flexibel.Det är meriterade om du har erfarenhet av:SQLverktyg för hantering av dataflöden (t.ex. SAS EG, LSF m.fl.)SAS Visual Investigator och SAS Visual Analyticsarbete inom området anti-penningtvätt och sanktionsscreening. Vi erbjuder Trygg arbetsgivareMöjligheter att utvecklas, både som individ och tillsammans med ditt team.Utmanande och utvecklande arbetsuppgifter.Work-life balanceSunda värderingar kring samhällsansvar och hållbarhetHälsa och friskvårdTjänstepension och försäkringPersonal-, lunch- och föräldraförmåner samt rådgivning Om oss Handelsbanken är en långsiktig och engagerad arbetsgivare. Vårt sätt att bedriva bank bygger framförallt på att vi har stor tilltro och respekt för den enskilde individen – både för våra kunder och våra medarbetare. Vi är en decentraliserad organisation där du som medarbetare får ett stort eget ansvar och stora befogenheter att ta egna beslut. Detta arbetssätt skapar delaktighet och ger varje medarbetare möjlighet att påverka bankens verksamhet. Långsiktiga affärsrelationer, lågt risktagande och kostnadsmedvetenhet är hörnstenar i Handelsbankens företagskultur och lägger grunden för att vår verksamhet bedrivs på ett ansvarsfullt, hållbart och framgångsrikt sätt över lång tid. För två år sedan firade vi 150 år som bank, kom och var med oss på nästa 150 år! Med över 2000 medarbetare är vi en av Sveriges största Tech-organisationer.Citat från Jonas, en av cheferna inom området: ”Att få arbeta inom området Financial Crime Prevention känns verkligen meningsfullt för mig på ett personligt plan, något jag inte upplevt i samma utsträckning i tidigare roller jag arbetat. Att identifiera och motverka finansiell kriminalitet är viktigt både för Handelsbanken och hela samhället i stort. Penningtvätt är ett gigantiskt globalt problem med stora konsekvenser för både individer och samhället och tillsammans inom området kan vi faktiskt göra skillnad! Det gillar jag.” Visa mer Visa mindre

Vill du jobba med utveckling hos en av Sveriges största banker? Sök då rollen som Javautvecklare idag.Handelsbanken är en stabil arbetsgivare med generöst förmånspaket och det finns stora möjligheter att göra karriär inom organisationen. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm, och området applicerar flexibelt arbetsliv vilket ger dig möjlighet att kombinera hemarbete med arbete på kontoret utifrån verksamhetens behov. Om tjänsten I din roll som javautvecklare kommer du att ligga i frontlinjen för att arbeta med ny teknik och leverera moderna lösningar. Du tillhör ett av integrationsområdets sex team, vilka alla ingår i ett agilt release-tåg som arbetar enligt SAFe-ramverket.Du kommer tillhöra området som jobbar dels med bankens centrala integrationsplattformar men som också skapar tjänster för regelverk, nya affärstjänster för våra kunder och arbetar med förutsättningar för att integrera mot nya molnbaserade lösningar.Det pågår mycket spännande utveckling och initiativ inom vårt område. Du kommer fördjupa din kunskap som utvecklare inom såväl din tekniska expertis som nya arbetssätt. Vi erbjuder dig ett utvecklande och kreativt arbete på en arbetsplats med god arbetsmiljö och hög kompetens, där dina idéer och din erfarenhet är välkommen. Dina kompetenser och personliga egenskaper Du har flerårig erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling med Java EE, REST, OpenAPI/Swagger, Json, XML, GIT och Maven. Du behöver ha god förståelse för både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift då vi jobbar med hela koncernen. Vi ser också att du har erfarenhet att jobba agilt enligt SAFe och/eller testdriven agil utveckling.Du trivs att jobba i en miljö där kontinuerlig förbättring är en del av vår vardag. Vi tror att du har ett stort eget driv och en vilja att lära dig tillsammans med andra. Som person är du ansvarstagande, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ. Du är en lagspelare som även kan arbeta självständigt.Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet avJPAMockitoJavascript/TypescriptReactTeam city eller annan byggserverDocker eller Kibana. Arbeta med tjänsteorienterad arkitektur och framtidens betallösningar som IT-arkitekt hos Handelsbanken. Du får utvecklas inom designmönster och utbyta erfarenheter med andra arkitekter från närmsta teamet och vårt SAFe tåg för betalningar. Om teamet & rollen Ditt närmsta team består av fyra andra arkitekter som är del av området för betalningar och Cash management, vi ansvarar för allt från Swish och svenska betalningar till komplexa företagstjänster. Området är i stor förändring till följd av förändrade kundbeteenden, teknikutveckling och nya regleringar. Vi är mitt i ett skifte och bygger en ny betalningsinfrastruktur, primärt med JavaEE och med PostgreSQL som databas.Som IT-arkitekt arbetar du med de arkitektoniska enablers som tåget behöver för en uppdaterad, relevant och framtidssäkrad architectural runway. Dina arbetsuppgifter blir både att operativt driva lösningar och stötta teamen i implementeringen av dem. Du får även arbeta proaktivt med att ta fram övergripande arkitekturbeskrivningar med fokus på utveckling i en tjänsteorienterad arkitektur.Du kan arbeta från vårt kontor i Stockholm eller Malmö och har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån delar av veckan utifrån verksamhetens behov.Dina kompetenser och personliga egenskaper För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en gedigen erfarenhet och djup kompetens kring design av affärssystem i Java. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT-arkitekt och med Azure, AKS eller motsvarande. Rollen innebär att du får många kontakter och därför behöver du kunna uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.Det är av vikt att du kan kommunicera och begripliggöra abstrakt information för både affärs- och utvecklingsspecialister. Som person har du förmåga att ta ägandeskap och leda andra på ett sätt som bidrar till förbättring och kompetensutveckling, både inom arkitektur och arbetssätt. Vi söker en erfaren Javautvecklare som vill vara med på en spännande förändringsresa och driva utvecklingen inom integrationslöning för Partsdata hos oss på Handelsbanken.Handelsbanken är en stabil arbetsgivare med generöst förmånspaket och det finns stora möjligheter att göra karriär inom organisationen. Teamet är en central del av många spännande utvecklingsinitiativ i banken.I rollen som javautvecklare tillhör du området som driver utvecklingen av masterdata framåt i banken. Se hit! Vi söker en driven och framåt nätverksspecialist som dessutom har bred kunskap och flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora komplexa nätverk. Känner du igen dig på den beskrivningen? Sök då till tjänsten som nätverksspecialist till Handelsbanken redan idag! Vi arbetar med stora infrastrukturinitiativ parallellt med ordinarie livscykelhanteringar och förvaltning. Det är stort fokus på standardiserings- och automatiseringsarbeten. Du har även arbetat med att förvalta och felsöka stora komplexa nät samt arbetat med brandväggar och brandväggsregler. Vi ser att du har en teknisk-utbildning eller motsvarande kunskaper som du fått genom tidigare arbete. Då vi jobbar med hela koncernen krävs god förståelse för både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.Vi ser nedanstående kunskap som meriterande:PythonDNS/InfobloxDNA-CenterCertifikatshantering och krypterad kommunikationDu är en ödmjuk och ansvarskännande person som är en självklar del i ett team. Du är strukturerad, noggrann och säkerhetsmedveten. Dokumentation ser du som en naturlig del av dina arbetsuppgifter. Du har förmågan att fatta egna beslut och arbetar målmedvetet med egen drivkraft. Are you passionate about advanced analytics, AI and data engineering? Do you want to lead our engineering team in providing state-of-the-art data solutions that enable us to deliver insights and models that drive Handelsbanken forward in a data-driven way? Then you should apply for the position as Engineering Team Lead and help us in our mission - to be a leader in using data, advanced analytics and AI to deliver superior products, service, and experience to our customers! Our Team As a key part of delivering on our mission we have set out to build brand new analytics platforms both on prem and in the Microsoft Azure cloud suite. Our engineering team works closely with other teams throughout the bank in an environment characterized by initiative, collaboration, and innovation to tackle business challenges by predicting outcomes, understanding complex data relationships and constructing models that contribute to a better experience for our customers. Together we are the tech savvy engineers who enable a customer-centric way of designing and building our analytics and data platforms. Your Role You will work in a cross-functional engineering team together with data scientists and business analysts to implement use cases identified for and by the business. You will also coach a team of various engineering roles in ML, data, DevOps and SW through leading by example. Coordinating the engineering team’s efforts in delivering superior stable data pipelines and model serving capabilities is at the core of your everyday work. This role is an excellent opportunity to develop both your technical and leadership abilities.Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Understand priorities, set requirements, and define a roadmap for our platform capabilities in collaboration with the Head of Data & ML Engineering and the Tech Lead,Plan and follow up on the day-to-day work, make sure that the team is focusing on the right tasks.Coordinate with stakeholders and relevant teams in other parts of the bank.Support the team’s well-being.Contribute with hands-on engineering work ranging from DevOps to Data & ML.Together with the Tech Lead, make sure that we are constantly improving on our ML & Data pipelines to deliver maximum business value. About You You have a master’s degree or equivalent in a technical field with above average academic results.You have excellent problem-solving skills and enjoy solving problems with code.Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Data/ML-oriented engineering role.Formal or informal experience of leading a team.Experience in Linux with a deep understanding of system design.You are willing to learn, or already know, basic Swedish.You constantly want to learn new skills and are proactive with your own development.Experience working with data and building data pipelines with respect to data modeling, orchestration and validation.Well versed in Python and SQL.It is meriting if you have experience of:Working with containerized development in a Linux environment.Working with test-driven development.Dbt, Prefect and Spark.Being in a scrum master role.We are looking for a person who fits the positive, friendly, and supportive culture of Handelsbanken. The ideal candidate is curious, inventive, strives for improvement every single day and shares our aim to be smart, humble and, above all, collaborative. We Offer The chance to develop fast, make a big impact and cut out new paths in an expanding team at the core of Handelsbanken’s ambitious focus on digitalization.An abundance of interesting opportunities and a focus on building new capabilities, not just maintaining what others have already created.A friendly and collaborative work environment where colleagues learn and achieve together.Competitive compensation and pension plan.Extensive benefit package (subsidized banking services, health care, lunch and more) .Flexibility to work from home part of the time.Office at prime location in central Stockholm. Your Application We look forward to receiving your CV. Furthermore, we are particularly interested in previous team work experience, what motivates you and achievements that you are proud of.The promotion of gender equality, diversity and an inclusive corporate culture is a fundamental part of our values. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to submit their applications. About us With over 2,000 employees, we are one of Sweden’s largest tech organisations. Our focus on the future is matched by our pride in our history. Therefore we’re constantly on the lookout for people with new skills who can see the challenges and opportunities in our digitalisation work. This applies to everything from operations, maintenance and system management to development, innovation and design. We have a decentralised organisational structure, in which you the employee are trusted to take a high degree of responsibility. Long-term business relations, low risk-taking and cost-awareness are cornerstones of Handelsbanken’s corporate culture. They form the basis of our banking operations being run in a responsible, sustainable and successful manner.When we recruit, we seek people who share the Bank’s fundamental values. The goal is for employees to reflect the markets in which we operate – with different backgrounds, skills, and work experience, as well as different ways of thinking and solving problems.
